body_content.explanation: to spoil or destroy something completely:
examples: Huge modern hotels have ruined this once unspoilt coastline.
Her injury ruined her chances of winning the race.

body_content.explanation: to cause a person or company to lose all their or its money or their or its good reputation:
examples: Cheap imported goods are ruining many businesses.
If there's a scandal I'll be ruined!

body_content.explanation: the process or state of being spoiled or destroyed:
examples: The car accident meant the ruin of all her hopes.
They let the palace fall into ruin.

body_content.explanation: a situation in which a person or company has lost all their money or their reputation:
examples: Many companies are on the edge/brink/verge of ruin.
Alcohol was my ruin (= the thing that spoiled my life)

body_content.explanation: the broken parts that are left of an ancient building or town:
examples: the ruins of the ancient city of Carthage

body_content.explanation: the broken parts that are left of a building or town that has been destroyed by bombs, fire, etc.:
examples: They live in the worst of the city's bombed-out ruins.
Nine bodies lie among the smoking ruins.

body_content.explanation: (of a building or city) to be extremely badly damaged so that most of it has fallen down:
examples: The town lay in ruins after years of bombing.

body_content.explanation: to be in an extremely bad state:
examples: The economy was in ruins after the war.
